00175 static const NDOF_ButtonT Generic_HID_map[] = {
00176     NDOF_BUTTON_1,
00177     NDOF_BUTTON_2,
00178     NDOF_BUTTON_3,
00179     NDOF_BUTTON_4,
00180     NDOF_BUTTON_5,
00181     NDOF_BUTTON_6,
00182     NDOF_BUTTON_7,
00183     NDOF_BUTTON_8,
00184     NDOF_BUTTON_9,
00185     NDOF_BUTTON_A,
00186     NDOF_BUTTON_B,
00187     NDOF_BUTTON_C
00188 };
00189 
00190 static const int genericButtonCount = sizeof(Generic_HID_map) / sizeof(NDOF_ButtonT);
00191 
00192 GHOST_NDOFManager::GHOST_NDOFManager(GHOST_System& sys)
00193     : m_system(sys)
00194     , m_deviceType(NDOF_UnknownDevice) // each platform has its own device detection code
00195     , m_buttonCount(genericButtonCount)
00196     , m_buttonMask(0)
00197     , m_hidMap(Generic_HID_map)
00198     , m_buttons(0)
00199     , m_motionTime(0)
00200     , m_prevMotionTime(0)
00201     , m_motionState(GHOST_kNotStarted)
00202     , m_motionEventPending(false)
00203     , m_deadZone(0.f)
00204 {
00205     // to avoid the rare situation where one triple is updated and
00206     // the other is not, initialize them both here:
00207     memset(m_translation, 0, sizeof(m_translation));
00208     memset(m_rotation, 0, sizeof(m_rotation));
00209 }
00210 
00211 bool GHOST_NDOFManager::setDevice(unsigned short vendor_id, unsigned short product_id)
00212 {
00213     // call this function until it returns true
00214     // it's a good idea to stop calling it after that, as it will "forget"
00215     // whichever device it already found
00216 
00217     // default to safe generic behavior for "unknown" devices
00218     // unidentified devices will emit motion events like normal
00219     // rogue buttons do nothing by default, but can be customized by the user
00220 
00221     m_deviceType = NDOF_UnknownDevice;
00222     m_hidMap = Generic_HID_map;
00223     m_buttonCount = genericButtonCount;
00224     m_buttonMask = 0;
00225 
00226     // "mystery device" owners can help build a HID_map for their hardware
00227     // A few users have already contributed information about several older devices
00228     // that I don't have access to. Thanks!
00229 
00230     switch (vendor_id) {
00231         case 0x046D: // Logitech (3Dconnexion)
00232             switch (product_id) {
00233                 // -- current devices --
00234                 case 0xC626: // full-size SpaceNavigator
00235                 case 0xC628: // the "for Notebooks" one
00236                     puts("ndof: using SpaceNavigator");
00237                     m_deviceType = NDOF_SpaceNavigator;
00238                     m_buttonCount = 2;
00239                     m_hidMap = Modern3Dx_HID_map;
00240                     break;
00241                 case 0xC627:
00242                     puts("ndof: using SpaceExplorer");
00243                     m_deviceType = NDOF_SpaceExplorer;
00244                     m_buttonCount = 15;
00245                     m_hidMap = SpaceExplorer_HID_map;
00246                     break;
00247                 case 0xC629:
00248                     puts("ndof: using SpacePilot Pro");
00249                     m_deviceType = NDOF_SpacePilotPro;
00250                     m_buttonCount = 31;
00251                     m_hidMap = Modern3Dx_HID_map;
00252                     break;
00253                 case 0xC62B:
00254                     puts("ndof: using SpaceMouse Pro");
00255                     m_deviceType = NDOF_SpaceMousePro;
00256                     m_buttonCount = 27;
00257                     // ^^ actually has 15 buttons, but their HID codes range from 0 to 26
00258                     m_buttonMask = 0x07C0F137;
00259                     m_hidMap = Modern3Dx_HID_map;
00260                     break;
00261 
00262                 // -- older devices --
00263                 case 0xC625:
00264                     puts("ndof: using SpacePilot");
00265                     m_deviceType = NDOF_SpacePilot;
00266                     m_buttonCount = 21;
00267                     m_hidMap = SpacePilot_HID_map;
00268                     break;
00269                 case 0xC621:
00270                     puts("ndof: using Spaceball 5000");
00271                     m_deviceType = NDOF_Spaceball5000;
00272                     m_buttonCount = 12;
00273                     break;
00274                 case 0xC623:
00275                     puts("ndof: using SpaceTraveler");
00276                     m_deviceType = NDOF_SpaceTraveler;
00277                     m_buttonCount = 8;
00278                     break;
00279 
00280                 default:
00281                     printf("ndof: unknown Logitech product %04hx\n", product_id);
00282             }
00283             break;
00284         default:
00285             printf("ndof: unknown device %04hx:%04hx\n", vendor_id, product_id);
00286     }
00287 
00288     if (m_buttonMask == 0)
00289         m_buttonMask = ~(-1 << m_buttonCount);
00290 
00291 #ifdef DEBUG_NDOF_BUTTONS
00292     printf("ndof: %d buttons -> hex:%X\n", m_buttonCount, m_buttonMask);
00293 #endif
00294 
00295     return m_deviceType != NDOF_UnknownDevice;
00296 }
00297 
00298 void GHOST_NDOFManager::updateTranslation(short t[3], GHOST_TUns64 time)
00299 {
00300     memcpy(m_translation, t, sizeof(m_translation));
00301     m_motionTime = time;
00302     m_motionEventPending = true;
00303 }
00304 
00305 void GHOST_NDOFManager::updateRotation(short r[3], GHOST_TUns64 time)
00306 {
00307     memcpy(m_rotation, r, sizeof(m_rotation));
00308     m_motionTime = time;
00309     m_motionEventPending = true;
00310 }
00311 
00312 void GHOST_NDOFManager::sendButtonEvent(NDOF_ButtonT button, bool press, GHOST_TUns64 time, GHOST_IWindow* window)
00313 {
00314     GHOST_ASSERT(button > NDOF_BUTTON_NONE && button < NDOF_BUTTON_LAST,
00315         "rogue button trying to escape NDOF manager");
00316 
00317     GHOST_EventNDOFButton* event = new GHOST_EventNDOFButton(time, window);
00318     GHOST_TEventNDOFButtonData* data = (GHOST_TEventNDOFButtonData*) event->getData();
00319 
00320     data->action = press ? GHOST_kPress : GHOST_kRelease;
00321     data->button = button;
00322 
00323 #ifdef DEBUG_NDOF_BUTTONS
00324     printf("%s %s\n", ndof_button_names[button], press ? "pressed" : "released");
00325 #endif
00326 
00327     m_system.pushEvent(event);
00328 }
00329 
00330 void GHOST_NDOFManager::sendKeyEvent(GHOST_TKey key, bool press, GHOST_TUns64 time, GHOST_IWindow* window)
00331 {
00332     GHOST_TEventType type = press ? GHOST_kEventKeyDown : GHOST_kEventKeyUp;
00333     GHOST_EventKey* event = new GHOST_EventKey(time, type, window, key);
00334 
00335 #ifdef DEBUG_NDOF_BUTTONS
00336     printf("keyboard %s\n", press ? "down" : "up");
00337 #endif
00338 
00339     m_system.pushEvent(event);
00340 }
00341 
00342 void GHOST_NDOFManager::updateButton(int button_number, bool press, GHOST_TUns64 time)
00343 {
00344     GHOST_IWindow* window = m_system.getWindowManager()->getActiveWindow();
00345 
00346 #ifdef DEBUG_NDOF_BUTTONS
00347     printf("ndof: button %d -> ", button_number);
00348 #endif
00349 
00350     NDOF_ButtonT button = (button_number < m_buttonCount) ? m_hidMap[button_number] : NDOF_BUTTON_NONE;
00351 
00352     switch (button)
00353     {
00354         case NDOF_BUTTON_NONE:
00355 #ifdef DEBUG_NDOF_BUTTONS
00356             printf("discarded\n");
00357 #endif
00358             break;
00359         case NDOF_BUTTON_ESC: sendKeyEvent(GHOST_kKeyEsc, press, time, window); break;
00360         case NDOF_BUTTON_ALT: sendKeyEvent(GHOST_kKeyLeftAlt, press, time, window); break;
00361         case NDOF_BUTTON_SHIFT: sendKeyEvent(GHOST_kKeyLeftShift, press, time, window); break;
00362         case NDOF_BUTTON_CTRL: sendKeyEvent(GHOST_kKeyLeftControl, press, time, window); break;
00363         default: sendButtonEvent(button, press, time, window);
00364     }
00365 
00366     int mask = 1 << button_number;
00367     if (press) {
00368         m_buttons |= mask; // set this button's bit
00369     }
00370     else {
00371         m_buttons &= ~mask; // clear this button's bit
00372     }
00373 }
00374 
00375 void GHOST_NDOFManager::updateButtons(int button_bits, GHOST_TUns64 time)
00376 {
00377     button_bits &= m_buttonMask; // discard any "garbage" bits
00378 
00379     int diff = m_buttons ^ button_bits;
00380 
00381     for (int button_number = 0; button_number < m_buttonCount; ++button_number) {
00382         int mask = 1 << button_number;
00383 
00384         if (diff & mask) {
00385             bool press = button_bits & mask;
00386             updateButton(button_number, press, time);
00387         }
00388     }
00389 }
00390 
00391 void GHOST_NDOFManager::setDeadZone(float dz)
00392 {
00393     if (dz < 0.f) {
00394         // negative values don't make sense, so clamp at zero
00395         dz = 0.f;
00396     }
00397     else if (dz > 0.5f) {
00398         // warn the rogue user/programmer, but allow it
00399         GHOST_PRINTF("ndof: dead zone of %.2f is rather high...\n", dz);
00400     }
00401     m_deadZone = dz;
00402 
00403     GHOST_PRINTF("ndof: dead zone set to %.2f\n", dz);
00404 }
00405 
00406 static bool atHomePosition(GHOST_TEventNDOFMotionData* ndof)
00407 {
00408 #define HOME(foo) (ndof->foo == 0.f)
00409     return HOME(tx) && HOME(ty) && HOME(tz) && HOME(rx) && HOME(ry) && HOME(rz);
00410 #undef HOME
00411 }
00412 
00413 static bool nearHomePosition(GHOST_TEventNDOFMotionData* ndof, float threshold)
00414 {
00415     if (threshold == 0.f) {
00416         return atHomePosition(ndof);
00417     }
00418     else {
00419 #define HOME(foo) (fabsf(ndof->foo) < threshold)
00420         return HOME(tx) && HOME(ty) && HOME(tz) && HOME(rx) && HOME(ry) && HOME(rz);
00421 #undef HOME
00422     }
00423 }
00424 
00425 bool GHOST_NDOFManager::sendMotionEvent()
00426 {
00427     if (!m_motionEventPending)
00428         return false;
00429 
00430     m_motionEventPending = false; // any pending motion is handled right now
00431 
00432     GHOST_IWindow* window = m_system.getWindowManager()->getActiveWindow();
00433 
00434     if (window == NULL) {
00435         return false; // delivery will fail, so don't bother sending
00436     }
00437 
00438     GHOST_EventNDOFMotion* event = new GHOST_EventNDOFMotion(m_motionTime, window);
00439     GHOST_TEventNDOFMotionData* data = (GHOST_TEventNDOFMotionData*) event->getData();
00440 
00441     // scale axis values here to normalize them to around +/- 1
00442     // they are scaled again for overall sensitivity in the WM based on user prefs
00443 
00444     const float scale = 1.f / 350.f; // 3Dconnexion devices send +/- 350 usually
00445 
00446     data->tx = scale * m_translation[0];
00447     data->ty = scale * m_translation[1];
00448     data->tz = scale * m_translation[2];
00449 
00450     data->rx = scale * m_rotation[0];
00451     data->ry = scale * m_rotation[1];
00452     data->rz = scale * m_rotation[2];
00453 
00454     data->dt = 0.001f * (m_motionTime - m_prevMotionTime); // in seconds
00455 
00456     bool weHaveMotion = !nearHomePosition(data, m_deadZone);
00457 
00458     // determine what kind of motion event to send (Starting, InProgress, Finishing)
00459     // and where that leaves this NDOF manager (NotStarted, InProgress, Finished)
00460     switch (m_motionState) {
00461         case GHOST_kNotStarted:
00462         case GHOST_kFinished:
00463             if (weHaveMotion) {
00464                 data->progress = GHOST_kStarting;
00465                 m_motionState = GHOST_kInProgress;
00466                 // prev motion time will be ancient, so just make up a reasonable time delta
00467                 data->dt = 0.0125f;
00468             }
00469             else {
00470                 // send no event and keep current state
00471                 delete event;
00472                 return false;
00473             }
00474             break;
00475         case GHOST_kInProgress:
00476             if (weHaveMotion) {
00477                 data->progress = GHOST_kInProgress;
00478                 // remain 'InProgress'
00479             }
00480             else {
00481                 data->progress = GHOST_kFinishing;
00482                 m_motionState = GHOST_kFinished;
00483             }
00484             break;
00485         default:
00486             ; // will always be one of the above
00487     }
00488 
00489 #ifdef DEBUG_NDOF_MOTION
00490     printf("ndof motion sent -- %s\n", progress_string[data->progress]);
00491 
00492     // show details about this motion event
00493     printf("    T=(%d,%d,%d) R=(%d,%d,%d) raw\n",
00494            m_translation[0], m_translation[1], m_translation[2],
00495            m_rotation[0], m_rotation[1], m_rotation[2]);
00496     printf("    T=(%.2f,%.2f,%.2f) R=(%.2f,%.2f,%.2f) dt=%.3f\n",
00497            data->tx, data->ty, data->tz,
00498            data->rx, data->ry, data->rz,
00499            data->dt);
00500 #endif
00501 
00502     m_system.pushEvent(event);
00503 
00504     m_prevMotionTime = m_motionTime;
00505 
00506     return true;
00507 }
